thread.title: Google YouTube Is Ending Those Annoying 30-Second Unskippable Ads You Hate | Stock News & Stock Market Analysis - IBD
thread.title_full: Google YouTube Is Ending Those Annoying 30-Second Unskippable Ads You Hate | Stock News & Stock Market Analysis - IBD

author: Investor'S Business Daily
title: Google YouTube Is Ending Those Annoying 30-Second Unskippable Ads You Hate | Stock News & Stock Market Analysis - IBD
text:
Google YouTube Is Ending Those Annoying 30-Second Unskippable Ads You Hate Google YouTube will end 30-second unskippable ads in 2018. (Google) Reprints 
Google YouTube will stop running unskippable 30-second ads as of 2018, the Alphabet ( GOOGL ) unit said on Friday. 
"We've decided to stop supporting 30-second unskippable ads as of 2018 and focus instead on formats that work well for both users and advertisers," Google said in a statement. 
Alphabet will still allow 20-second unskippable ads as well as the six-second ads introduced last April. 
That comes after Facebook ( FB ) recently announced that it would bar pre-roll ads, meaning that Facebook will soon only allow mid-roll ads. CEO Mark Zuckerberg sees Facebook's future in video, and any effort to improve the user experience will help. 
Alphabet's Google also has said that skippable ads deliver strong engagement . 
With unskippable ads, users may simply click to another page, or switch to another tab while the marketing airs. With skippable ads, users may pay attention for the first five seconds before they can skip. That's decent engagement, and many users may stick around for the full around once they've gotten started.
